intro: Echeandia cholulensis, commonly known as the Cholula echeweed, is a flowering plant native to the highlands of central Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or well-drained soils and thrives in temperate climates. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, while its flowers are small and clustered in a head. Echeandia cholulensis is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and along forest edges.
